intro: Brachyramphus heyneanus, commonly known as the short-billed murrelet, is a small seabird belonging to the family Muridae. It is characterized by its compact body, short bill, and distinctive plumage that includes a white belly and dark upper body. This species is primarily found in coastal regions of the northern Pacific Ocean, where it nests in dense vegetation near the shoreline.
